intro: Senecio songaricus, commonly known as the Songaricus groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, and its leaves are usually narrow and hairy. Senecio songaricus is often used in traditional medicine, though its toxicity requires caution in handling.
